page.title: 01AROUND LOCHFOOT
page.content: OUR BLOCK IS IN THE STEWARTRY DISTRICT OF DUMFRIES AND GALLOWAY REGION IN THE SOUTH WEST OF SCOTLAND.THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS COVER A SIZEABLE PART OF THE PARISH OF LOCHRUTTON WHILE THE NORTHERN THIRD CONTAINS CORNERS OF TWO NEIGHBOURING PARISHES,IRONGRAY AND TERREGLES. THE MAIN ROAD FROM GRETNA TO STRANRAER,THE A75, RUNS FROM EAST TO WEST THROUGH THIS BLOCK, ABOUT HALF A MILE FROM LOCHFOOT VILLAGE.RUNNING PARALLEL WITH THIS ROAD IS THE OLD MILITARY ROAD WHICH PASSES THROUGH LOCHFOOT ON ITS WAY FROM DUMFRIES TO CASTLE DOUGLAS.THE NORTHERN HALF OF LOCHRUTTON LOCH LIES BETWEEN LOCHFOOT AND THE SOUTHERN BOUNDARY OF THE BLOCK.THE REST OF OUR AREA CONSISTS MAINLY OF A FARMING LANDSCAPE.
